Body: Paul got a box of 521 crayons and 66 erasers for his birthday. At the end of the school year he only had 154 left while not having lost a single erasers.
Question: How many crayons had been lost or given away?

Body: Danny collects bottle caps and wrappers. He found 10 bottle caps and 62 wrappers at the park. Now he has 27 bottle caps and 43 wrappers in his collection.
Question: How many more wrappers than bottle caps does danny have now?

Question: How many bags did she find after monday?

Question: How many rows could she make?

Question: How many more storks than birds are sitting on the fence?

Body: Jessie weighed 114 kilograms. After she started to go jogging everyday she lost 50 kilograms in the first week and 60 kilograms in the second week.
Question: How much does she weigh now?
